meanings.definition: To fill with blood and swell
meanings.sent1: The mosquito will engorge itself on blood until it is full.
meanings.sent2: After the rain, the river began to engorge and overflow its banks.
meanings.sent3: The balloon started to engorge with air, making it look like a giant bubble.
meanings.sent4: Her cheeks engorged with embarrassment as she blushed furiously.
meanings.sent5: The sponge will engorge with water until it can hold no more.

meanings.sent1: The hungry dog will engorge its food in seconds.
meanings.sent2: He tends to engorge on snacks when he watches movies.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon managed to engorge itself on all the leftovers in the trash can.
meanings.sent4: The bookworm would engorge on novels, finishing one after another.
meanings.sent5: The child would engorge on candies until his stomach ached.
